thread.title: GTA 6 2025 release date is causing major problems
thread.title_full: GTA 6 2025 release date is causing major problems

author: @ladbible
title: GTA 6 2025 release date is causing major problems
text:
Published 12:27 17 Dec 2024 GMT GTA 6â€™s release date is causing major problems for anyone looking to buy another game in 2025 Grand Theft Auto VI is causing a few issues Tom Earnshaw
Grand Theft Auto VI is causing problems. And it is all to do with the release date of the hotly anticipated video game.
Easily the most anticipated video game product of all time, GTA 6 was announced in December 2023 where it sent fans of the GTA universe in to overdrive with a 91 second trailer .
Gamers were introduced to Lucia, the first playable female protagonist in the GTA universe. And since then, there has been a big old vacuum of information from developer Rockstar and parent company Take-Two .
Advert
We're now talking more than 12 months without any real update on how the game is getting on, with a release date of 2025 the only information shared in the initial trailer. Well, it is this approach from Rockstar and Take-Two that is starting to cause a domino effect across the video game industry.
GTA 6 date latest As it stands, '2025' is all we know about GTA 6.
Advert
Take-Two issued a company update in the autumn where it spoke about all of its active projects, which included GTA 6 but also the eagerly anticipated Borderlands 4 and Mafia: The Old Country.
In this, Take-Two confirmed 2025 was still happening following community rumours of a delay to 2026.
And on top of that, it specified when in 2025 the game will drop.
"With many exciting new titles coming in fiscal 2026 - including GTA 6 in the Fall, Borderlands 4 and Mafia: The Old Country - we expect to create long-term value for our shareholders," Take-Two said.
Advert
That means GTA 6 should definitely come in September, October, and November 2025, according to the very latest from Take-Two.
Is a delay on the cards? (Rockstar) Unease over GTA 6 in the industry Three months is a long time and other developers are getting a bit restless with this, according to reports.
Advert
Right now, it has been reported that many planning releases are waiting to see if GTA will fully commit to a specific date in the autumn/fall of 2025 or if a delay to 2026 is actually happening.
And you can't blame them. Speak to any industry insider and they believe GTA 6 will easily go down as the best selling video game of all time. With it expected to also fetch a hefty price tag, and excess incomes being stretched as the cost of living remains far higher than it did when GTA 5 was released in 2023, there's only so much money people have for video games.
Not only that, GTA 6 is expected to be a massive game. Sit down to play that and you should be there for a very long time with little time for anything else. No developer in their right mind would want to release their product around the same time; it's simple business.
Lucia will be the main character of the game (Rockstar) Release date 'could slip', insider says Gaming analyst Jason Schreier, an insider on all things GTA , reckons a delay to 2026 would be pretty unsurprising.
Advert
"I would be shocked if GTA 6 actually made it next year," he said on the Kinda Funny Games Daily podcast.
"I think that it will probably slip again because Rockstar games always slip."
He referenced the double delay to Rockstar's previous gaming masterpiece, Red Dead Redemption 2 , which was delayed to spring 2018 and then autumn 2018 before finally being released when in a condition developers thought to be as perfect as it could be. And it was, so you can understand why Rockstar would delay again, if it indeed decides to do so.
Featured Image Credit: Rockstar Topics: GTA , Gaming , Technology , Business , World News
Tom Earnshaw Tom joined LADbible in 2024, specialising in SEO and trending content. He moved to the company from Reach plc where he enjoyed spells as a content editor and senior reporter for one of the country's most-read local news brands, LancsLive. When he's not in work, Tom spends his adult life as a suffering Manchester United supporter after a childhood filled with trebles and Premier League titles. You can't have it all forever, I suppose.
